START.name: Introduction
START.desc:
'Ah you've awoken! It's about time!' You blink rapidly and your eyes begin to focus on a short and stout man.  He has a crooked nose, a scruffy beard, a bloodied brow and an overall ragged appearance.  You don't recognize him or remember how you wound up in the field.  You ask him who he is.

Strange man: 'Ay Lad, I'm Sir Gerald the Grande.  If ye don't know who I am then you must've gotten hit in the noggin pretty hard.  I've seen you around the castle plenty a times.' 

He offers you his hand.

STAND.name: Introduction continued
STAND.desc:
You take his hand, stand up, and take in your surroundings. 

First you notice the scattered, beaten and bloodied bodies lying in the fields around you.  You cringe and feel even more confused as you still can't recall a thing.  Then your eyes wander to a tall, stone castle to your North which looks like its seen better days.  The drawbridge is up, and the place doesn't seem at all inviting.  Despite the scene before you, the environment feels remarkably calm, and the birds sing as if nothing has happened.  You turn towards Sir Gerald only to realize he is significantly shorter than you first observed. You perceive him to be a dwarf and ask him what happened here. 

Sir Gerald: 'Ain't it obvious?  There was a battle this morning - started late last night when the king was murdered.  According to the whispers, the kind was poisoned by his greedy no good brother.  Good thing I hid when I heard the shouts.  See, I'm only the royal treasurer; I don't have any battle experiience.  It's a shame though. He was a decent king.  Not too many of those as of late, someone's always hungerin' for power nowadays.  Too many arrogant, greedy kings...' the dwarf rambled. 

You: 'So what am I supposed to do exactly? I don't even remember what happened.'

Sir Gerald: 'Well yer the last living knight of the former king, so I figure ya gotta find and rescue the princess.'

You: 'How will that help things?'

Sir Gerald: 'It might not, but the whispers say she's got some magical powers or somethin'.  Maybe she can restore peace?' He shrugs and starts to turn away. 'Well best of luck to ye.  Oh! Take this with ye on yer quest!' He hands you a lightweight, sharp steel sword that seemingly came from nowhere. It's so shiny that it seems as if it's never left the armory.  Although a bit shorter than you would have preferred, it'll serve you well, nevertheless.

Sir Gerald: 'Hopefully it'll be of some use to you - more than it's been to me at least. Farewell!'

The dwarf heads off into the woods to your South, away from the castle.

GROUND.name: Lying in a field awkwardly
GROUND.desc: Sir Gerald stares at you curiously. You should probably take his hand before things get awkward.

WCASTLE.name: West of the Castle
WCASTLE.desc: This is an open field west of a tall stone castle. There is no door on this side of the castle, and the walls are to high to scale without rope.

NCASTLE.name: North of the Castle
NCASTLE.desc:
You are standing in a field, facing the north side of a tall stone castle. There is no door here,
and all the windows are too tall to scale without a rope.

SCASTLE.name: South of the Castle
SCASTLE.desc:
You are standing in a field and facing the south side of a tall, stone castle. There is a large wooden drawbridge but it is lifted up,
and all the windows are too tall to scale without rope.

ECASTLE.name: East of the Castle
ECASTLE.desc: This is an open field east of a tall stone castle. There is no door on this side of the castle, but there is a lovely watch tower that is too tall to scale without a rope.

DRWBRDG.name: Drawbridge: entrance to the Castle
DRWBRDG.desc: This a drawbridge. It can only be opened from the inside of the castle.

RAVINE.name: A field overlooking a perilous ravine
RAVINE.desc: It's a beautiful ravine, but it's rather large and the river down there looks pretty threatening. You can't cross it. I recommend going another direction.

FORE1.name: Forest West of Castle
FORE1.desc: This is a forest, with somewhat tall trees surrounding you. Light peaks through the canopy, and there are footpaths leading to the north, west, and south. The sounds of a river seem to be coming from further west.

FORE2.name: Forest South of Castle
FORE2.desc:
This is a dimly lit forest, with large leafy trees surrounding you.  To the
west, there appears to be a footpath and sunlight.

RIVER.name: Riverbank
RIVER.desc: This is a wide but calm river. The bushes on the other side are quite thick. Maybe if you use your sword you can get through. To the north, along the river you see a footpath. South of you is a steep wall of slate. It looks to be the rocky beginning of a mountain. You can't go this way.

ACROSS.name: Across the river
ACROSS.desc: You wade across the river and the water level comes up to your knees. It's chilly, and you think you might've caught a fish in your boot. You begin to wack at the bushes with your new sword. You discover it feels quite natural and thankfully the amenesia hasn't affected your skills. You slice through the bushes easily and stumble across a shady path. Tall trees and their fallen leaves line the path. Sunlight flirts with the canopy leaves. It's beautiful and peaceful. Suddenly you hear shouts coming from back across the river.

PATH.name: Down the Path
PATH.desc: You decide to ignore the shouts for now; it took a lot of effort to get here so might as well explore while you can. You follow the path for awhile and the seen barely changs. One thing stands out to you however, you've noticed some rather large footprints...

ARCH.name: Stone arch
ARCH.desc: The path ends in a massive stone arch and suddenly ruins begin to sprout from the trees and bushes nearby. Cautiously, you approach the arch when suddenly you detect voices. Loud and deep voices.

TROLL.name: You've stumbled upon a troll camp
TROLL.desc:
The voices seem too be getting louder and you duck behind a nearby pillar and listen to their conversation. Just as you're ducking behind the pillar, you catch a glimpse of two trolls.

Troll one: 'I'm ravenous! I haven't had fresh elf in AGES. Sure we have our fair share of humans after that battle they just had with each other-'
Troll two:'Ha ha! Stupid humans!'
Troll one:'Groff what did I tell you about interupting me?'
Groff:'Sorry Bulborus...'
Bulborus:'As I was saying, I haven't had elf in decades. Those sneaky tree huggers are too good at hiding. It isn't fair that they're the tastiest. Especially when humans are so dry and tough and wait - what's that smell?'

You freeze. They're really close now. All that's separating you is the pillar you're hidden behind and a few robust bushes.

Groff: 'Wait I smell it too. I know that smell! That's human!'

You start to sweat profusely and think up some swears that your mother would've kicked you out of the house for. You desperately scan your surroundings, looking for an escape route or some form of a plan. All you see is a few decent sized rocks near the base of the pillar that you might be able to use as a distraction while you sneak away through the woods, or you could just hit them with the rocks and make a break for it...

(Try 'Distract' or 'Throw')

SUCCESS.name: Success!
SUCCESS.desc:
Thankfully, trolls are quite stupid, so when you threw the rock far away from you, they chased fake you shouting about how they were going to eat you. Lucky for you, your craftiness saved your skin, and you were able to escape through the forest back to the very start of the path.

To return to the river before you crossed, enter: 'return'. Otherwise, 'back' will guide you all the way back.

FAIL.name: BAD IDEA!
FAIL.desc: Trolls are known for two things: being incredibly stupid (which would've been very useful if you had throw the rock as a distraction) and having HORRIBLE tempers. Your rock throws confused them at first, but then they got REALLY angry and well... you perished. Sorry 'bout that. Try again next time?

FORE3.name: Forest North of Castle
FORE3.desc:
This is a dimly lit forest, with large, leafy green trees surrounding you. To the west there appears to be sunlight and a footpath. One
particularly large tree with some low branches stands here.

TREE.name: Up a Tree
TREE.desc: You've climbed the tree and breached the canopy to see smoke coming from a chimney off to the West somewhere.

FORE4.name: Forest far north of Castle
FORE4.desc:
This is a large forest, with trees obstructing all views except
to the west, where a small clearing and a cottage can be seen through the trees.

COTTAGE.name: Small cottage
COTTAGE.desc: This is a small stone cottage. The door appears to be ajar, and there's a little smoke coming from the chimney.

exits.target: Not an option. Try something else.

LROOM.name: in the living room of a small cottage
LROOM.desc: You enter the cottage and walk into the living room. There doesn't seem to be much here except an old rocking chair, a small circular wooden table with basic wood chairs and a worn out rug. It seems as though the previous owners left in a hurry. If you continue, you'll enter the bedroom. If you go right, you enter the kitchen.

BEDROOM.name: Cottage bedroom
BEDROOM.desc: This room is just as dull as the last. There's only a bed, a wardrobe and a hooded cloak haphazardly thrown over a nearby chair. You grab it just for funsies.

KITCH.name: Cottage kitchen
KITCH.desc: There's a coal stove in the corner with a few burning embers. It seems as though it hasn't been used in several hours. There's also a counter, a small makeshift tin sink, and a tiny window facing east towards... a tower?

FORE5.name: in forest North West of the abandoned castle
FORE5.desc: This is more forest, with trees surrounding you from all directions. There is a particularly tall tree with many thick branches gradually circling the trunk in an upwards spiral. It looks climbable.

TREE2.name: Up the Spiral Tree
TREE2.desc: You climb the tree and survive with only a few scrapes on your knees. You breach the canopy to see smoke coming from a chimney off to the South West and a tall brick tower to the NorthEast.

ELF.name: near a kidnapped elf
ELF.desc: You're following the stream when you hear distant shouts. You approach cautiously to discover an elf tied to a tree with rope. Near the elf are two trolls who are debating the best way to cook elf. They're boiling a cauldron of water and their backs are turned away from the miserable elf who you can barely see from your position between some bushes with the most beautiful flowers you've ever seen.

ATTENTION.name: The elf sees you waving
ATTENTION.desc:
They turn around and you realize the elf is a little girl. She looks barley above the age of 8. She's dressed in an elegant light blue dress. Her hair is dark brown and chin length, and she wears a flower crown made of clematis or 'bee's jubilee. She's tiny and her cheeks are bright red and damp with tears. When she sees you waving, her eyes light up. It seems as if she has an idea.

'LET ME GO!' She shouts and strains against the ropes that bind her to the tree. Startled, you feel the urge to run, but she holds eye contact with you, so you wait. The trolls shout dismissals and don't even turn around. You take this as a cue that they won't notice you approaching, but if they did catch you then you both would be dead. You could try to fight them... (verb options: CUT ROPE, FIGHT)

FREEELF.name: You approach the elf girl
FREEELF.desc: The trolls don't notice you (they aren't naturally attentive creatures) and you cut through one of the rope loops with your sword. You untangle the rest and sling it over your shoulder just in case. You both escape successfully, but you need to hide somewhere or they might notice and catch you.

TOWER.name: Tall brick tower
TOWER.desc: You've come across a tall brick tower. If you have freed the elf, then you can climb this tower. If not, you need to free the elf.

PRINCESS.name: Top of the Tower
PRINCESS.desc:
You and your elf companion climb to the top of the brick tower using the ropes that the trolls had used to keep her hostage. When you reach the top, you are immediately assaulted by a young lady with very short hair and the angriest expression you've ever seen.

'Who are you?! Are you my kidnappers?! Finally decided to show your sorry faces huh?! I'll whoop your ass if you try to touch me again! My father has drained me since birth! I will throw you from this tower I swear it!' She shouts as she holds a knife against your throat. Her eyes keep shifting to your elf friend who's name you still don't know.
Your elf companion turns to you and raises an eyebrow. You start to speak but the woman's grip gets stronger.
'We aren't kidnappers.' You weaze.'We're hiding from trolls! I swear!' Your elf friend nods eagerly along. The woman doesn't let up her grip, but stares between the two of you considering your words. While she's thinking you get a good look at her and realize she looks familiar. Based on what she's told you, you assume she muust be someone from the castle at the least; if your luck holds, then she's the princess.
'Um, miss?,' your elf friend pipes up. 'Could you let him go, please?' The woman lets you go cautiously without saying a word and takes several steps back. You sink to the floor in relief. You have two options, leave the tower and give up on this quest, move to a nice kingdom with less trolls probably, live out your days in the sun.. or you can try to convince the princess to take back her kingdom.

WAITING.name: Convince the princess
WAITING.desc:
You: 'I promise you princess, we are not here to hurt you. I was sent by Sir Gerald to come find you so you can do some juju and save the kingdom. I promise that is my only intent. I don't have a great memory of the event, but aparently your uncle poisoned your father, and I'm not sure what that's about, but clearly the poisoner can't be the good guy here. So... what do ya say? Will you help us regain the kingdom?

The princess looks at you like you're crazy and says 'I don't have any juju or whatever, but we do have a family loop hole we might be able to use to regain the kingdom. It's unpredictable and very risky, so unless you've got something more appealing than revenge in mind, I'm definitely out.'

LAME.name: You chose to give up
LAME.desc: You're not a very honorable knight you know, but I get it. Good luck finding a non-troll infested kingdom! (Type Quit to end game)

LEAVE.name: Almost there...
LEAVE.desc:
You look the princess in the eyes and say, 'You really want to spend the rest of your miserable life in this tower? Who even feeds you? You might as well TRY and get your kingdom back. As it is, I have amnesia fighting for this stupid kingdom. Do something!'
The princess looks perturbed but sighs and agrees to 'at least try'. You aren't too thrilled about the idea of her ruling if she cares this little, but you're kinda tired of this quest at this point and you'd rather not encounter any more trolls. A nice cushy palace life should fix that one.

 The princess informs you that she knows of a secret tunnel that leads into the castle's kitchen. You decide to follow her.

SECRETTUNNEL.name: Secret tunnel into the kitchen
SECRETTUNNEL.desc: There isn't much here to be honest. Dirt floors, old stone walls, the usual tunnel. It smells quite musty and your footsteps echo. You decide you aren't a big fan of tunnels.

CKITCH.name: Castle Kitchen
CKITCH.desc: The tunnel leads up to a big wooden door. It looks like the door to a cellar. The princess does a special knock and after several minutes of repeated knoocking, finally someone opens the door. Thankfully, it's friendly kitchen staff. They speak with the princess and inform her about her uncle's doings and suddenly she's furious again. Something about how she hadn't believed me because I was showing up to a tower in the middle of nowhere, and I didn't have credibility and blah blah blah. The point is, she's been in that tower for maybe 3 years and she only trusts those she knows. Once the kitchen staff confirmed the story, the princess was ready to raise hell. She bursts through the kitchen doors, storming towards the throne room to take back her crown.

THRONE.name: Throne Room
THRONE.desc:
Welcome to the boss battle!!! In the north corner we have your villain! It's none other than the princess's uncle! Awkard.
In the other corner we have the princess herself and boy does she look angry!
How do you win, you wonder? It's easy! Rock, paper, scissors! There's been enough battle lately and who wants to kill their family - even if one of our two competitors has already done just that... Anywho! Loser gets prison for life (and since you're in association with the princess - that means you too!) On the count of 3!
One... Two... Three...

WIN.name: END
WIN.desc: Congrats! You won rock paper scissors and it is safe to assume that you got your cushy castle life!
